title: Very quaint little village
text: Very quaint little town to visit. The priory is lovely, there are a handful of places to eat and interesting shops to look in. Great for walks.

title: Simply Stunning
text: We did a helicopter ride over the falls as well as a boat trip. Both were amazing and the scenery incredible.

title: Simply amazing
text: A must do visit if you're visiting Mexico to see the ancient Mayan ruins and pyramids. We happened to be there at the Autumn equinox. El Castillo is aligned so that the equinoxes create an optical illusion. As the sun sets, the north western corner of the terraces cast a shadow on the northern stairway, creating a diamond pattern representing a snake’s body. The effect is enhanced by the huge snake heads carved at the bottom of the stairs.

title: Stunning
text: Stunning place to visit and appreciate the beauty of the falls, rivers and scenery around Taupo. We also did a speedboat ride which was so much fun.

title: Simply stunning
text: An amazing visit to a wonderful archaeological site. As you make you way through the site and reach the coast - the views of the sea and beaches below are just stunning. Well worth a visit.

title: Absolutely Stunning
text: Well worth a visit to see the amazing buildings and squares. Warsaw has changed so much over the years and really is old meets new. It is vibrant with many lovely shops and restaurants to visit.

title: Lake Windermere - stunning views
text: Lovely to walk around the shore and visit the town of Bowness. Weather was mild with stunning scenery and sunsets. Easy to book a oat trip to Ambleside or other nearby towns. Stayed in a nearby lodge which was quiet and away from the bustle of the town.

title: Lovely food
text: Lovely Spanish tapas food in a very modern but cosy restaurant spread out over 3 floors. Service was good, food was good, good wine list.

title: Amazing food
text: Lovely tapas restaurant offering amazing food. Lots of ambience. The food was inceridibly tasty and the service was very good.

title: Christmas Carol concert
text: The concert was lovely. As always the Halle are just wonderful to listen too and we were were treated to the adult and youth choirs singing both classic and unknown carols written by different composers. .

title: Amazing food - highly recommended
text:
From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed and looked after. The restaurant was very well designed and modern with a lovely ambience. Simon was cooking along with the chef in the open area which was great to see. I'm vegetarian and the food was incredible, exploding with flavours.
The service all round was exceptional.

title: Absolutely Stunning
text: What an amazing beach to visit on the Whitsunday Islands - voted one of the best in the world. We went by boat from Hamilton Island - just fantastic!

title: Great place to visit
text: Lovely views - recommend going here to see the sunset. Great photo opportunities. Great place to visit

title: Lots of fun
text: Well worth a visit. . We watched the cliff divers whilst eating. Food was great - the best veggie burger I've ever had! Amazing sunset.

title: Great food set by a beautiful beach
text: Really worth a visit to sample the local food and dine by the beautiful Seven mile beach. Large portions of food!

title: Stunning
text: Really worth a visit. We came here to eat and to get a catamaran out for a sunset cruise. Simply beautiful

title: A must do!
text: We did a tour and walked through the waterfall - it was really amazing. The guide was great and took photos.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
We just loved it! Set on a beautiful beach on the west coast with clear, warm sea we had a great time. Ideal for the children, plenty to do and food was very good.
Friendly staff, lively atmosphere but not overly so.
We stayed in a quiet room with sea view towards the end of the complex so it was ideal.

title: Amazing to see
text: A must do in Athens. The stunning Acropolis citadel with the ancient Parthenon, Temple of Athena Nike, open air Theatres. Visit early and buy tickets in advance to avoid the crowds.

title: Day trip to Saranda
text: We took the ferry from Corfu to Saranda embankment as a day trip. It was good value and a great way to do some extra sightseeing. Small public beach area and several restaurants at the embankment.

title: Corfu Old town - beautiful
text: We visted for a day and really enjoyed it. The Old Fortress Citadel and church is really a must to visit. (Buy tickers in advance to avoid the queues) We visited the port and went on a boat trip and it was lovely to see the coastline.

title: Great location
text: We had a great time - the chldren loved it. Onsite pool and facilities were fine. Plenty to see and do and places to visit locally. We stayed in a deluxe caravan which was really nice and had everything that we needed.
place: Hafan y Mor Holiday Park - Haven

title: Great to see and wonderful walk around the grounds
text: The gardens are lovely, the hall is really well worth a visit. Walking around the Dunham Massey grounds and walk tracks you will see wild deer. Nice restauranrs and good facilities.

title: Fabulous food
text: Wonderful tasty food, great choice, good atmosphere. Large portions. Great deal on lunchtime menu. Really nice restaurant and helpful, friendly staff.

title: Bella Italia
text: Children enjoyed their meals. Not a great deal of vegetarian choice. Busy restaurant and service was quite slow.

title: Cafe Rouge
text: Good menu, reasonably priced, play areas for the children. The service was good. Would recommend and go again.
place: Cafe Rouge - Center Parcs Whinfell Forest

title: Penrith Castle
text: Penrith Castle is well worth a visit, the children loved it, It is very close to Centerparcs if you are staying there.

title: Great for the children
text:
We went inbetween Christmas and New Year and had a great time.
The children enjoyed being outdoors in the forest. We did adventure golf and saw the pantomime. They love swimming so really enjoyed the slides and the outdoor pools in particular.
There were also fireworks which was a nice surprise in readiness for the new year celebrations.
The 2 story lodge was really nice with an infrared room to relax in.

title: Nice restaurant to relax in after the waterfall trail walk
text:
Good choice of food and drinks. Play area outside for the kids. Loved the record player and vinyls!
Service OK

title: Santas Sleigh Day & Artic Circle
text:
It was brilliant! After landing and collecting snowsuits, we went to Santa's Village first, where we were able to do a husky ride, a reindeer ride and the children met Santa. We had lunch in a traditional restaurant with traditional food - really nice with veggie options.
The children loved playing in the snow. There was also a teepee tent with fire and warm drinks. What an adventure with stunning scenery.
We then went to the Artic Circle and souvenir shopping.
A very long day and not enough time spent at the Village but really worth it and so magical for the children who were totally convinved that they had met real Santa.

title: Fabulous restaurant and fabulous food!
text: Seriously, the food was amazing, the staff were great and the restaurant was so lovely inside that we went back every day for dinner. Great location too.

title: Best way to get to and from the airport
text: Best way to get to and from the airport. A great adventure for my children! Also a really nice way to start the sightseeing as you come into Venice.

title: So pretty to see
text: You can capture some great photos here especially at sunset. It gets very busy and crowded but worth the visit.

title: Really beautiful - a must see
text: Just stunningly beautiful - book a skip the line ticket to avoid the queues. Well worth visit to this remarkable city.

title: Gondola ride on Grande Canal
text: We loved it! We booked a shared gondola ride to share the cost. Great way to see the sides and great fun!

title: St Mark's Square and Bell Tower
text: We booked a skip the line ticket to go up the bell tower in St Mark's square. Stunning views across the city and water/ Really worthwhile!

title: Stunning Hotel
text:
Highly recommended. Beautiful hotel in good location. Really stylish and opulent. We stayed in a junior suite which had two levels and was very nice.
There are restaurants and shops literally on the doorstep.
Easy to walk to the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge.

title: Great place to visit!
text: My children loved this! Not only enchanted by the chocolate, but to be able to visit the mine underneath. Lots of fun and recommended.

title: Ruskin's View
text: Lovely walk by the river. We went to Devil's bridge and started the walk from there. the trail leads into the local market town Kirkby Lonsdale. We walked down the embankment by the river. Very pretty and scenic.

title: Stunning waterfall trail
text:
With several different waterfalls to find on the trail, and stunning scenery along the way, this was a great walk to do.
It's an energetic walk, lots of steps and quite uneven in places. If you take your time, the entire trail can last for 4 hours or so. Wear the appropriate clothes, walking shoes and take water and snacks.
I took my two young children and we took our time and walked to the first main waterfall in approx 40 minutes.
